Crimes.Dispute_Type: Judicial review discontinuation and cost recovery

Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Existence of 'special reasons' for awarding costs

Crimes.Legal_Standard: 'Special reasons' required for cost awards under Rule 22

Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Removal order quashed; costs awarded to respondents

Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Lack of timely resolution caused unfair burden

Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Minister challenged jurisdiction but discontinued case

Crimes.Omission_Type: Administrative oversight in visa issuance process

Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Division lacked jurisdiction, but costs awarded due to unnecessary litigation

Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Removal order issued despite family having valid visas
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Jurisdiction based on legal status at time of removal order

Crimes.Governing_Rule: Immigration Act provisions on appeal rights
Crimes.Outcome: Costs awarded to respondents despite lack of jurisdiction
Crimes.Decisional_Body: Immigration Appeal Division and Federal Court
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Unnecessary expense and trouble caused by Minister
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: IAD jurisdiction dependent on valid status
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Focused on timing of status expiration
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No jurisdiction, but special reasons for costs
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Jurisdictional requirements under the Immigration Act
